title: What will happen to our dependency on technology, will it increase or decrease in the near future? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not sure we could become more dependent on technology than we are today. Back to the stone age? Everyone but country farmers would likely starve within a year if the power went out today. Actually, most of the farmers are liking to end up starving too, since without technology, the diesel for their tractors couldn’t be produced or delivered. We’d (those that were left) soon be back to hunting and gathering, and THAT technology won’t support even 1% of today’s population. The real question is, can we maintain our technological lifestyle as the climate emergency continues to worsen and impact our civilization without any sign of abatement? As all the forests burn, the fish die off, the crops fail due to floods and drought, the cities go underwater and billions of people are displaced, how will we do? Perhaps we need to start asking some more serious questions. Like, what are we going to do to change the unsustainable direction we are heading in?

Increase in terms of everyday life unless you make a concerted effort to organize your life to avoid it. In either way, you’ll be confronted with commercial and governmental organizations that are highly dependent on technology to process you interactions with them, so you’ll find it impossible to avoid dependency altogether.
